yaml.title: Synthesio AI Analytics Dashboard
yaml.description: Natural language to SQL analytics powered by R, DuckDB, and Claude AI

markdown.markdown:
```{=html}
R Shiny Claude AI DuckDB ellmer
``` Business intelligence tools typically require either expensive licences, specialist SQL knowledge, or slow report-request cycles. The question: *what if anyone could ask a plain English question and get an instant, visualised, AI-narrated answer?* ## The Solution Synthesio is a proof-of-concept AI analytics dashboard built entirely in R. It combines: - **ellmer** — to interface with Claude's API for both SQL generation and insight narration - **DuckDB** — as a fast, embedded analytical database (no server required) - **R Shiny + shinychat** — for the interactive dashboard and conversational UI - **Plotly + reactable** — for rich visualisations and searchable data tables ## Demo ```{=html}
``` ## Architecture The core pipeline follows three steps: 1. **NL → SQL** — The user's question is sent to Claude along with a database schema description. Claude returns a valid DuckDB SQL query. 2. **SQL → Results** — The query executes against the Northwind database in DuckDB, returning a dataframe. 3. **Results → Insight** — The dataframe is summarised and sent back to Claude, which returns a business narrative in markdown. ```{=html}
User question
   ↓ generate_sql() via ellmer + Claude
SQL query
   ↓ dbGetQuery() via DuckDB
Dataframe
   ↓ generate_insight() via ellmer + Claude
Markdown narrative + Plotly chart + reactable table
``` ## Key Technical Decisions **Why DuckDB?** Fast columnar analytics without any server setup. Works perfectly with R via the DBI interface, and handles CSV imports gracefully with `readr::read_csv`. **Why ellmer?** The cleanest R-native interface to Claude's API. Supports streaming, tool use, and multi-turn conversations — important for future iterations. **Why shinychat?** Provides a ready-made chat UI component that integrates seamlessly with Shiny's reactive model, allowing the AI conversation to drive dashboard state. ## What's Next - Connecting to live databases (PostgreSQL, Snowflake) - Multi-turn conversational memory for follow-up questions - User authentication and saved query history - Deployment to a cloud environment with secure API key management ## Source Code The full source code is available on GitHub: [github.com/YOUR_USERNAME/synthesio](https://github.com/YOUR_USERNAME/synthesio)
